description.narrative: The programme is poised to address persistent challenges in Peace, Security and Systems Resilience in Uganda that manifest themselves as: conflicts related to natural resources; inter-communal and cross border conflicts including regional spill over effects from neighboring countries. The expected project results are: 1. By end 2020, targeted public institutions establish and implement a comprehensive regulatory framework to foster peace, equal participation, dialogue, social cohesion and regional security. 2. By end 2020, targeted institutions detect, plan, coordinate, manage and monitor con

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

description.narrative: 1. No. of policies addressing peace and social cohesion developed and implemented 2. Existence of functional CSOs/national platforms facilitating effective internal dialogue, mediation and conflict transformation efforts 3. Number of South-South and Triangular cooperation partnerships that deliver measurable and sustainable development benefits for participants (national, regional, sub-regional, inter-regional entities) (IRRF 7.5.1) 4. Number of districts with gender- and human rights-sensitive contingency plans developed and operationalized 5. Number of platforms facilitating effective internal and cross-border dialogue, mediation, reconciliation and conflict transformation efforts 6. Percentage of women/men who think Government handles/resolves conflict between communities well 7. Existence of harmonized functional national early warning system 8. Extent to which policy and institutional reforms increase access to social protection schemes targeting the poor and other at-risk groups, dis-aggregated by sex (IRRF 1.2.1) (rating scale 1-4) 9. Existence of an operational legal/regulatory framework enabling excluded groups to function and contribute to development

comment.narrative:
1. 0 (2013) policies addressing peace and social cohesion developed and implemented 2. No (2013) functional CSOs/national platforms facilitating effective internal dialogue, mediation and conflict transformation efforts 3. Two (2014) South-South and Triangular cooperation partnerships that deliver measurable and sustainable development benefits for participants (national, regional, sub-regional, inter-regional entities) 4. 10 (2013) districts with gender- and human rights-sensitive contingency plans developed and operationalized 5. Four (2013) platforms facilitating effective internal and cross-border dialogue, mediation, reconciliation and conflict transformation efforts 6. 52% (Male to Female: 52/ 51); (Rural to Urban: 52/48) (2012) of women/men who think Government handles/resolves conflict between communities well 7. No (2013) harmonized functional national early warning system 8. Level 2: Extent to which policy and institutional reforms increase access to social protection schemes targeting the poor and other at-risk groups, dis-aggregated by sex (IRRF 1.2.1) (rating scale 1-4)
9. No (2013) operational legal/regulatory framework enabling excluded groups to function and contribute to development
